benchmark_details.name: Video-OCR bench
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces Video-OCR bench, the first comprehensive benchmark to evaluate visual LLMs in various video-OCR tasks. It consists of 1,028 videos and 2,961 question-answer pairs, divided into 6 sub-tasks to evaluate modelsâ€™ ability on text recognition, semantic understanding, spatial relation, movement detection, text attribute recognition, and temporal localization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the video OCR performance of multi-modal models in videos and advance research in video LLMs.

data.source: Constructed using a semi-automated approach that integrates the OCR ability of image LLMs with manual refinement.
data.annotation: Semi-automated with human refinement and manual checks

methods: Using a semi-automated approach to manufacture data
methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated by checking whether the model's answer matches the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates good performance on OCR tasks.
methodology.validation: Human annotators reviewed and refined question-answer pairs.
